org.sd.cluster.config
Class ClusterDefinition

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cluster.config.ClusterDefinition

public class ClusterDefinition
extends java.lang.Object

Class to encapsulate a cluster definition.

Author:
Spence Koehler

CLUSTER_GROUP_DEFINITION_PROPERTY

public static final java.lang.String CLUSTER_GROUP_DEFINITION_PROPERTY
The "Group Definition" identifies a dynamic cluster configuration.

NOTE: Either generic ('node-') or specific ('machineA') machine names are acceptable, but generic naming requires the machines to be defined separately.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ClusterDefinition

public ClusterDefinition(java.lang.String user,
                         java.lang.String defName,
                         Tree<java.lang.String> clusterDef,
                         java.lang.String gateway,
                         java.lang.String[] machines)
Construct with the given generic clusterDef tree, substituting the given gateway for the "gateway" and machine names for the "nodes" in the definition tree.

This can be used in conjunction with ConfigGenerator in order to create on-the-fly cluster definitions that need not be persisted.

Method Detail

getClusterDefinition

public static final ClusterDefinition getClusterDefinition(java.util.Properties properties)
Get the (first) cluster definition identified in the given properties.

See getClusterDefinitions for a description of the properties.

getClusterDefinition

public static final ClusterDefinition getClusterDefinition(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                           java.util.Properties properties)
Get the (first) cluster definition identified in the given properties.

See getClusterDefinitions for a description of the properties.

getClusterDefinitions

public static final java.util.List<ClusterDefinition> getClusterDefinitions(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                            java.util.Properties properties)
Get the cluster definitions identified in the given properties.

Parameters:
prefix - Prefix to use (as prefix.key) when retrieving definition properties. (Okay if null.)
properties - Properties identifying definition parameters. Properties:
  • 'gateway'
  • ClusterDefinition Properties (choose 1 of 3 different ways to define)
    • Using a persisted configuration...
      • 'clusterDefDir' (optional)
          • ...with a single property for combined pieces of information
        • 'clusterDef' == "user defname machines"; where
          • 'user' is the cluster user
          • 'defname' is the persisted definition name e.g. 1m1n.1 to be found at "clusterDefDir/1m1n.1.def"
          • 'machines' is the comma-delimited list of machines to use with defname.
          ...with a property for each piece of information:
        • 'clusterUser' is the cluster user
        • 'clusterDefName' (same format as 'defname' above)
        • 'clusterMachines' (same format as 'machines' above)
    • Using an on-the-fly generated configuration:
      • 'clusterUser' is the cluster user
      • 'clusterMachines' (same format as 'machines' above)
      • 'clusterGroupDef' == "groupNameA:nodeDefs1 groupNameB:nodeDefs2 ..."; where
        • 'groupName' is a group name for the nodeDefs
        • 'nodeDefs' == "nodeDef1,nodeDef2,..."
        • 'nodeDef' == "nodeN-C" or "machine-C"
        • 'node' is literally 'node'
        • 'N' is the number (1-based) for the node's machine
        • 'C' is the number of jvms (nodes) to run on the machine
        • 'machine' is the hostname of a machine
      • e.g. for a 3 node cluster using machines "machA" with 1 node, "machB" with 2 nodes, and "machC" with 2 nodes and having machA as a "controller" group while machB and machC nodes are all in the "processor" group, either of the following forms can be used:
      • clusterDef="user 3m5n.1-4 machA,machB,machC"
      • groupDefs="controller:machA-1 processor:machB-2,machC-2" clusterUser="user"
      • groupDefs="controller:node1-1 processor:node2-2,node3-2" clusterUser="user" clusterMachines="machA,machB,machC"

getTopInfo

public java.lang.String[] getTopInfo(boolean fix)
Get the initial user and machine through which to deploy and/or start a cluster.

Typically, the initial machine will be the gateway. If the gateway is "localhost" and there is only one node under the gateway node and the gateway user is the same as the cluter user, then the initial machine will be the first node under the gateway.

Returns:
{topUser, topMachine}

getMachineNames

public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getMachineNames(int level,
                                                              boolean fix)
Get the unique machine names at the given level.

Parameters:
level - If 0, get all machines; else get machines at indicated level.
fix - If true, normalize the machine names.
Returns:
the machine names.

getGroupNodeNames

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupNodeNames(java.lang.String groupName,
                                                          boolean fix)
Get the names of nodes in the given group. If the result is null, then the current node is the only node in the group.

Note these are of the form machineName-jvmNum.

Parameters:
groupName - Group for which to get nodes. If null, then the current node is the only node in the group and null is returned. Special groupName ALL_NODES_GROUP returns all (but the root, or gateway, node).
fix - If true, normalize the machine names.
Returns:
the node names, or null.

Get the names of nodes at the given level.

Note these are of the form machineName-jvmNum.

Parameters:
level - If 0, get all nodes; else get nodes at indicated level.
fix - If true, normalize the machine names.
Returns:
the node names.

getServerAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getServerAddress(java.lang.String nodeWithNum)
Get the server address for this definition's user's identified node.

Parameters:
nodeWithNum - The node in the form machineName-jvmNum.
Returns:
the server address or null if the user or node are invalid.

getServerAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getServerAddress(java.lang.String machineName,
                                                   int jvmNum)
Get the server address for this definition's user's identified node.

Parameters:
machineName - The machine name.
jvmNum - The jvm number.
Returns:
the server address or null if the user or node are invalid.

getServerAddresses

public java.net.InetSocketAddress[] getServerAddresses(java.lang.String groupName)
Get the server address for this definition's user's identified node.

Parameters:
groupName - The name of the group identifying the cluster nodes for which to get addresses. NOTE: null would indicate to get the current node's server address, but we require the caller to know it's own node's name and number, so null will be returned. ALL_NODES_GROUP indicates to get all but the gateway's addresses. Otherwise, the group as defined in the cluster definition is used.
Returns:
the server addresses or null if the user or level are invalid.
